010package imagingbook.lib.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
024
025import imagingbook.lib.math.Arithmetic.DivideByZeroException;
026import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
027
028/**
029 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
030 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
031 * objects structures. 
032 * Matrices are simply two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
033 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
034 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
035 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
036 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
037 * 
038 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@code multiplyD()}) operate destructively,
039 * i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.</p>
040 * 
041 * <p>Most methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.</p>
042 * 
043 * @author W. Burger
044 * @version 2019/01/05
045 */
046public abstract class Matrix {
047        
048        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers. */
049        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
050        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements. */
051        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
052        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
053        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
054        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements. */
055        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
056        
057        // ----  Vector and matrix creation -----------------------------
058
059        public static double[] createDoubleVector(int length) {
060                return new double[length];
061        }
062        
063        public static float[] createFloatVector(int length) {
064                return new float[length];
065        }
066        
067        public static double[][] createDoubleMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
068                return new double[rows][columns];
069        }
070        
071        public static float[][] createFloatMatrix(int rows, int columns) {
072                return new float[rows][columns];
073        }
074        
075        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
076        
077        /**
078         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued vector of the 
079         * specified length.
080         * @param length the length of the vector
081         * @return a vector with zero values
082         */
083        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
084                if (length < 1)
085                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
086                return new double[length];
087        }
088        
089        /**
090         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
091         * specified size.
092         * @param size the size of the matrix
093         * @return an identity matrix
094         */
095        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
096                if (size < 1)
097                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
098                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
099                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
100                        A[i][i] = 1;
101                }
102                return A;
103        }
104        
105        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
106
107        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
108                return A.length;
109        }
110        
111        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
112                return A[0].length;
113        }
114        
115        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
116                return A.length;
117        }
118        
119        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
120                return A[0].length;
121        }
122        
123        // Extract rows or columns
124        
125        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
126                return A[r].clone();
127        }
128        
129        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
130                final int rows = A.length;
131                double[] col = new double[rows];
132                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
133                        col[r] = A[r][c];
134                }
135                return col;
136        }
137        
138        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
139        
140        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
141                final int nCols = A[0].length;
142                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
143                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
144                                return false;
145                        }
146                }
147                return true;
148        }
149        
150        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
151                final int nCols = A[0].length;
152                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
153                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
154                                return false;
155                        }
156                }
157                return true;
158        }
159        
160        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
161                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
162        }
163        
164        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
165                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
166        }
167        
168        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
169                return a.length == b.length;
170        }
171        
172        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
173                return a.length == b.length;
174        }
175        
176        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
177                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
178        }
179        
180        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
181                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
182        }
183
184        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
185
186        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] A) {
187                return A.clone();
188        }
189        
190        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] A) {
191                return A.clone();
192        }
193
194        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
195                final int m = A.length;
196                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
197                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
198                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
199                }
200                return B;
201        }
202        
203        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
204                final int m = A.length;
205                float[][] B = new float[m][];
206                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
207                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
208                }
209                return B;
210        }
211        
212        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
213        
214        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] A) {
215                final int m = A.length;
216                final float[] B = new float[m];
217                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
218                        B[i] = (float) A[i];
219                }
220                return B;
221        }
222        
223        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
224                final int m = A.length;
225                final int n = A[0].length;
226                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
227                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
228                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
229                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
230                        }
231                }
232                return B;
233        }
234        
235        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] A) {
236                final int m = A.length;
237                final double[] B = new double[m];
238                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
239                        B[i] = A[i];
240                }
241                return B;
242        }
243        
244        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
245                final int m = A.length;
246                final int n = A[0].length;
247                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
248                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
249                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
250                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
251                        }
252                }
253                return B;
254        }
255        
256        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
257        
258        public static void fillD(final float[] A, float val) {
259                Arrays.fill(A, val);
260        }
261        
262        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
263                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
264                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
265                }
266        }
267        
268        public static void fillD(final double[] A, double val) {
269                Arrays.fill(A, val);
270        }
271        
272        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
273                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
274                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
275                }
276        }
277        
278        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
279        
280        // non-destructive
281        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
282                double[] c = b.clone();
283                addD(a, c);
284                return c;
285        }
286        
287        // destructive, b is modified
288        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
289                if (!sameSize(a, b))
290                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
291                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
292                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
293                }
294        }
295        
296        // non-destructive
297        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
298                float[] c = b.clone();
299                addD(a, c);
300                return c;
301        }
302        
303        // destructive, b is modified
304        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
305                if (!sameSize(a, b))
306                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
307                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
308                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
309                }
310        }
311
312        // non-destructive
313        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
314                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
315                addD(A, C);
316                return C;
317        }
318        
319        // destructive, B is modified
320        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
321                if (!sameSize(A, B))
322                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
323                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
324                        for (int j = 0; j < A[j].length; j++) {
325                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
326                        }
327                }
328        }
329        
330        // non-destructive
331        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
332                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
333                addD(A, C);
334                return C;
335        }
336        
337        // destructive, B is modified
338        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
339                if (!sameSize(A, B))
340                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
341                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
342                        for (int j = 0; j < A[j].length; j++) {
343                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
344                        }
345                }
346        }
347        
348        // ------------------------------------------------
349        
350        // non-destructive a - b
351        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
352                if (!sameSize(a, b))
353                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
354                final int n = a.length;
355                double[] c = new double[n];
356                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
357                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
358                }
359                return c;
360        }
361        
362        // non-destructive a - b
363        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
364                if (!sameSize(a, b))
365                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
366                final int n = a.length;
367                float[] c = new float[n];
368                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
369                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
370                }
371                return c;
372        }
373
374        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
375
376        // non-destructive
377        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] a) {
378                double[] b = a.clone();
379                multiplyD(s, b);
380                return b;
381        }
382        
383        // destructive
384        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] a) {
385                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
386                        a[i] = a[i] * s;
387                }
388        }
389        
390
391        // non-destructive
392        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
393                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
394                multiplyD(s, B);
395                return B;
396        }
397        
398        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
399                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
400                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
401                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
402                        }
403                }
404        }
405        
406        // non-destructive
407        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] A) {
408                float[] B = duplicate(A);
409                multiplyD(s, B);
410                return B;
411        }
412        
413        // destructive
414        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] A) {
415                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
416                        A[i] = A[i] * s;
417                }
418        }
419
420        // non-destructive
421        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
422                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
423                multiplyD(s, B);
424                return B;
425        }
426        
427        // destructive
428        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
429                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
430                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
431                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
432                        }
433                }
434        }
435        
436        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
437
438        /**
439         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A from the right, i.e., y = x * A,
440         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
441         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
442         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
443         * @return a (row) vector of length n
444         */
445        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
446                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
447                multiplyD(x, A, y);
448                return y;
449        }
450        
451        /**
452         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
453         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
454         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
455         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
456         */
457        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException {
458                if (x == y) 
459                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
460                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
461                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
462                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
463                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
464                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
465                        double s = 0;
466                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
467                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
468                        }
469                        y[i] = s;
470                }
471        }
472
473        /**
474         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
475         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
476         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
477         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
478         * @return a (column) vector of length m
479         */
480        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
481                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
482                multiplyD(A, x, y);
483                return y;
484        }
485        
486        /**
487         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
488         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
489         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
490         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
491         */
492        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
493                if (x == y) 
494                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
495                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
496                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
497                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
498                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
499                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
500                        double s = 0;
501                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
502                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
503                        }
504                        y[i] = s;
505                }
506        }
507        
508        /**
509         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
510         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
511         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
512         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
513         * @return a (column) vector of length m
514         */
515        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
516                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
517                multiplyD(A, x, y);
518                return y;
519        }
520        
521        /**
522         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
523         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
524         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
525         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
526         */
527        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
528                if (x == y) 
529                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
530                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
531                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
532                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
533                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
534                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
535                        double s = 0;
536                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
537                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
538                        }
539                        y[i] = (float) s;
540                }
541        }
542        
543
544        
545        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
546        
547        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
548        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
549                int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
550                int q = getNumberOfColumns(B);
551                double[][] C = createDoubleMatrix(m, q);
552                multiplyD(A, B, C);
553                return C;
554        }
555        
556        // A * B -> C (destructive)
557        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
558                if (A == C || B == C) 
559                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
560                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
561                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
562                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
563                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
564                if (nA != mB)
565                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
566                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
567                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
568                                double s = 0;
569                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
570                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
571                                }
572                                C[i][j] = s;
573                        }
574                }
575        }
576        
577        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
578        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
579                // TODO: also check nA = mB
580                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
581                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
582                float[][] C = createFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
583                multiplyD(A, B, C);
584                return C;
585        }
586
587        // A * B -> C (destructive)
588        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
589                if (A == C || B == C) 
590                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
591                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
592                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
593                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
594                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
595                if (nA != mB)
596                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
597                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
598                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
599                                float s = 0;
600                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
601                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
602                                }
603                                C[i][j] = s;
604                        }
605                }
606        }
607        
608        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
609        
610        /**
611         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
612         * which must have the same length.
613         * @param x first vector
614         * @param y second vector
615         * @return the dot product
616         */
617        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
618                if (!sameSize(x, y))
619                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
620                double sum = 0;
621                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
622                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
623                }
624                return sum;
625        }
626        
627        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
628        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
629        /**
630         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
631         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
632         * m is the length of the second vector.
633         * @param x first vector (of length m)
634         * @param y second vector (of length n)
635         * @return the outer product (matrix)
636         */
637        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
638                final int m = x.length;
639                final int n = y.length;
640                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
641                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
642                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
643                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
644                        }
645                }
646                return M;
647        }
648
649        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
650
651        /**
652         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
653         * @param x a vector
654         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
655         */
656        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
657                double sum = 0;
658                for (double val : x) {
659                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
660                }
661                return sum;
662        }
663
664        /**
665         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
666         * @param x a vector
667         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
668         */
669        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
670                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
671        }
672
673        /**
674         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
675         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
676         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
677         * @param x a vector
678         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
679         */
680        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
681                double sum = 0;
682                for (double val : x) {
683                        sum = sum + (val * val);
684                }
685                return sum;
686        }
687        
688        /**
689         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
690         * @param x a vector
691         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
692         */
693        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
694                double sum = 0;
695                for (double val : x) {
696                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
697                }
698                return (float) sum;
699        }
700
701        /**
702         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
703         * @param x a vector
704         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
705         */
706        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
707                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
708        }
709
710        /**
711         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
712         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
713         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
714         * @param x a vector
715         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
716         */
717        public static float normL2squared(final float[] x) {
718                double sum = 0;
719                for (double val : x) {
720                        sum = sum + (val * val);
721                }
722                return (float) sum;
723        }
724        
725        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
726        
727        /** 
728         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
729         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
730         * number of elements.
731         * @param x first vector
732         * @param y second vector
733         * @return the distance
734         */
735        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
736                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
737        }
738        
739        /** 
740         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
741         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
742         * number of elements.
743         * @param x first vector
744         * @param y second vector
745         * @return the squared distance
746         */
747        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
748                double sum = 0;
749                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
750                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
751                }
752                return sum;
753        }
754        
755        /** 
756         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
757         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
758         * number of elements.
759         * @param x first vector
760         * @param y second vector
761         * @return the distance
762         */
763        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
764                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
765        }
766        
767        /** 
768         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
769         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
770         * number of elements.
771         * @param x first vector
772         * @param y second vector
773         * @return the squared distance
774         */
775        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
776                double sum = 0;
777                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
778                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
779                }
780                return (float) sum;
781        }
782        
783        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
784        
785        /**
786         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
787         * @param A a matrix
788         * @return the norm of the matrix
789         */
790        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
791                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
792                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
793                double s = 0;
794                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
795                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
796                                s = s + A[i][j] * A[i][j];
797                        }
798                }
799                return Math.sqrt(s);
800        }
801
802        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
803
804        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
805                double sum = 0;
806                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
807                        sum = sum + x[i];
808                }
809                return sum;
810        }
811        
812        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
813                double sum = 0;
814                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
815                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
816                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
817                        }
818                }
819                return sum;
820        }
821        
822        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
823                double sum = 0;
824                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
825                        sum = sum + x[i];
826                }
827                return (float) sum;
828        }
829        
830        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
831                double sum = 0;
832                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
833                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
834                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
835                        }
836                }
837                return sum;
838        }
839        
840        // --------------------------------------------------
841        
842        /**
843         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
844         * @param A a matrix
845         * @param row the row index
846         * @return the sum of the row's elements
847         */
848        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
849                return sum(A[row]);
850        }
851        
852        /**
853         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
854         * @param A a matrix
855         * @param row the row index
856         * @return the sum of the row's elements
857         */
858        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
859                return sum(A[row]);
860        }
861        
862
863        /**
864         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
865         * @param A a matrix
866         * @param col the column index
867         * @return the sum of the column's elements
868         */
869        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
870                double sum = 0;
871                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
872                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
873                }
874                return sum;
875        }
876        
877        /**
878         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
879         * @param A a matrix
880         * @param col the column index
881         * @return the sum of the column's elements
882         */
883        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
884                double sum = 0;
885                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
886                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
887                }
888                return (float) sum;
889        }
890        
891        /**
892         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
893         * them as a vector with one element per row.
894         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
895         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
896         */
897        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
898                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
899                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
900                        double sum = 0;
901                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
902                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
903                        }
904                        sumVec[r] = sum;
905                }
906                return sumVec;
907        }
908        
909        /**
910         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
911         * them as a vector with one element per row.
912         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
913         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
914         */
915        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
916                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
917                for (int r = 0; r < sumVec.length; r++) {
918                        double sum = 0;
919                        for (int c = 0; c < A[r].length; c++) {
920                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
921                        }
922                        sumVec[r] = (float) sum;
923                }
924                return sumVec;
925        }
926        
927        /**
928         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
929         * them as a vector with one element per column.
930         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
931         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
932         */
933        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
934                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
935                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
936                        double sum = 0;
937                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
938                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
939                        }
940                        sumVec[c] = sum;
941                }
942                return sumVec;
943        }
944        
945        /**
946         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
947         * them as a vector with one element per column.
948         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
949         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
950         */
951        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
952                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
953                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
954                        double sum = 0;
955                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
956                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
957                        }
958                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
959                }
960                return sumVec;
961        }
962        
963        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
964        
965        public static float min(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
966                if (x.length == 0)
967                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
968                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
969                for (float val : x) {
970                        if (val < minval) {
971                                minval = val;
972                        }
973                }
974                return minval;
975        }
976        
977        public static double min(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
978                if (x.length == 0)
979                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
980                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
981                for (double val : x) {
982                        if (val < minval) {
983                                minval = val;
984                        }
985                }
986                return minval;
987        }
988        
989        public static float max(final float[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
990                if (x.length == 0)
991                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
992                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
993                for (float val : x) {
994                        if (val > maxval) {
995                                maxval = val;
996                        }
997                }
998                return maxval;
999        }
1000        
1001        public static double max(final double[] x) throws ZeroLengthVectorException {
1002                if (x.length == 0)
1003                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1004                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1005                for (double val : x) {
1006                        if (val > maxval) {
1007                                maxval = val;
1008                        }
1009                }
1010                return maxval;
1011        }
1012        
1013        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1014                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1015                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1016                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1017                                if (val > maxval) {
1018                                        maxval = val;
1019                                }
1020                        }
1021                }
1022                return maxval;
1023        }
1024        
1025        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1026                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1027                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1028                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1029                                if (val > maxval) {
1030                                        maxval = val;
1031                                }
1032                        }
1033                }
1034                return maxval;
1035        }
1036        
1037        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1038        
1039        /**
1040         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1041         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1042         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1043         */
1044        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1045                int n = 0;
1046                for (float[] x : xs) {
1047                        n = n + x.length;
1048                }
1049                float[] va = new float[n];
1050                int j = 0;
1051                for (float[] x : xs) {
1052                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1053                                va[j] = x[i];
1054                                j++;
1055                        }
1056                }               
1057                return va;
1058        }
1059
1060        /**
1061         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1062         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1063         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1064         */
1065        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1066                int n = 0;
1067                for (double[] x : xs) {
1068                        n = n + x.length;
1069                }
1070                double[] va = new double[n];    
1071                int j = 0;
1072                for (double[] x : xs) {
1073                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1074                                va[j] = x[i];
1075                                j++;
1076                        }
1077                }               
1078                return va;
1079        }
1080        
1081        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1082        
1083        /**
1084         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1085         * vector, which contains an additional 1-element.
1086         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1087         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1088         */
1089        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1090                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1091                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
1092                        xh[i] = xc[i];
1093                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
1094                }
1095                return xh;
1096        }
1097        
1098        /**
1099         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
1100         * vector, which is one element shorter.
1101         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
1102         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
1103         */
1104        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
1105                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
1106                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
1107                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
1108                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
1109                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
1110                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
1111                }
1112                return xc;
1113        }
1114        
1115        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
1116        
1117        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1118                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1119                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1120                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1121        }
1122        
1123        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1124                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
1125                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1126                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
1127        }
1128        
1129        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1130                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1131                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1132                return
1133                                A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
1134                                A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
1135                                A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
1136                                A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
1137                                A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
1138                                A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1139        }
1140
1141        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) throws IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1142                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
1143                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1144                return 
1145                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
1146                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
1147                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
1148                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
1149                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
1150                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
1151        }
1152        
1153        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1154                if (!isSquare(A))
1155                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1156                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1157                return new LUDecomposition(M).getDeterminant();
1158        }
1159        
1160        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
1161        
1162        public static double trace(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1163                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1164                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1165                if (m != n) 
1166                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1167                double s = 0;
1168                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1169                                s = s + A[i][i];
1170                }
1171                return s;
1172        }
1173        
1174        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
1175        
1176        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
1177                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1178                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1179                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
1180                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1181                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1182                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1183                        }
1184                }
1185                return At;
1186        }
1187        
1188        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
1189                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1190                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1191                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
1192                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1193                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1194                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
1195                        }
1196                }
1197                return At;
1198        }
1199        
1200        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
1201        
1202        /**
1203         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1204         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
1205         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1206         * @param A a square matrix
1207         * @return the inverse matrix
1208         */
1209        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1210                if (!isSquare(A))
1211                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1212                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1213                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
1214        }
1215        
1216        /**
1217         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
1218         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1219         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1220         * @param A a square matrix
1221         * @return the inverse matrix
1222         */
1223        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
1224                if (!isSquare(A))
1225                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
1226                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
1227                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
1228        }
1229
1230        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
1231        
1232        /**
1233         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear systems of equations
1234         * A * x = b. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
1235         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
1236         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
1237         * @param b a vector of length n
1238         * @return the solution vector of length n
1239         */
1240        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
1241                RealMatrix AA = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
1242                RealVector bb = MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b);
1243                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(AA).getSolver();
1244//              double[] x = null;
1245//              try {
1246//                      x = solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1247//              } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
1248                return solver.solve(bb).toArray();
1249        }
1250        
1251        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
1252        
1253        public static String toString(double[] x) {
1254                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1255                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1256                printToStream(x, strm);
1257                return bas.toString();
1258        }
1259        
1260        public static String toString(float[] x) {
1261                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1262                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1263                printToStream(x, strm);
1264                return bas.toString();
1265        }
1266        
1267        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
1268                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1269                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1270                printToStream(A, strm);
1271                return bas.toString();
1272        }
1273        
1274        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
1275                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1276                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
1277                printToStream(A, strm);
1278                return bas.toString();
1279        }
1280        
1281        // --------------------
1282        
1283        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
1284                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1285                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1286                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1287                        if (i > 0)
1288                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1289                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
1290                }
1291                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1292                strm.flush();
1293        }
1294        
1295        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1296                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1297                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1298                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1299                        if (i == 0)
1300                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1301                        else
1302                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1303                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
1304                                if (j == 0) 
1305                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1306                                else
1307                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1308                        }
1309                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1310                }
1311                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1312                strm.flush();
1313        }
1314        
1315        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
1316                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1317                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1318                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1319                        if (i > 0)
1320                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
1321                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
1322                }
1323                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1324                strm.flush();
1325        }
1326        
1327        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
1328                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
1329                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1330                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
1331                        if (i == 0)
1332                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
1333                        else
1334                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
1335                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1336                                if (j == 0) 
1337                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
1338                                else
1339                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
1340                        }
1341                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1342                }
1343                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
1344                strm.flush();
1345        }
1346
1347        // Exceptions ---------------------
1348        
1349        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
1350                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1351                
1352                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
1353                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
1354                }
1355        }
1356        
1357        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
1358                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1359                
1360                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
1361                        super("square matrix expected");
1362                }
1363        }
1364        
1365        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
1366                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1367                
1368                public SameSourceTargetException() {
1369                        super("source and target must not be the same");
1370                }
1371        }
1372        
1373        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
1374                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
1375                
1376                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
1377                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
1378                }
1379        }
1380

1383//              s = -1.0 / 1E-200; // / 1E-200;
1384//              System.out.println(Double.isFinite(s));
1385//              
1386//      }
